variant.question: If there is any danger on the route, how will ATC inform the pilot?

options.text: ATC will transmit to the pilot information about distance and bearing to the potential threat.
ATC will transmit to the pilot information about GPS data of the potential threat.
ATC will transmit to the pilot information about latitude and longitude of the potential threat.
ATC will transmit to the pilot information about separation time and distance to the potential threat.

When an aircraft subjected to an act of unlawful interference must depart from its assigned track or its assigned cruising level without being able to make radiotelephony contact with ATS, the pilot-in-command should, whenever possible

options.text: attempt to broadcast warnings on the VHF emergency frequency and other appropriate frequencies, unless considerations aboard the aircraft dictate otherwise.
attempt to broadcast warnings on the VHF emergency frequency only.
commence an emergency descent.
proceed at a level which differs from the cruising levels normally used for IFR flight in the area by 150 m (500 ft) if above FL290 or by 300 m (1 000 ft) if below FL290.

variant.question: When an aircraft subjected to an act of unlawful interference must depart from its assigned track or its assigned cruising level without being able to make radiotelephony contact with ATS, the pilot-in-command should, whenever possible:

change the transponder code to the present code plus 5.
fly at the corresponding IFR flight level plus or minus 200 ft.
once established on the new track, change the track every 5 minutes by 5 degrees.

variant.question: An aircraft experiences radio communication failure over the ocean but still within US territory. The aircraft is registered in Italy and the Operator is in France. Which procedures do you follow?

options.text: The pilot must follow the lost comm procedure of the US, since he/she is over the US.
The pilot must follow the lost comm procedure of Italy, since the aircraft is registered in Italy.
The pilot must follow the lost comm procedure of France, since the operator is in France.
Italy and USA rules apply, however Italy has priority because the aircraft is registered in Italy.

Proceed to English Channel to make a right racetrack pattern, climb 5 000 ft and start dumping there.
Climb straight ahead until 4 000 ft and start dumping upon reaching.
Climb straight ahead an start dumping immediately.
